clinical_study.brief_title: Toripalimab Combined With Anlotinib for Patients With Advanced, Relapsed, or Refractory Gastric, or Esophagogastric Junction Cancer (EGJC)
clinical_study.official_title: The Affiliated Hospital of Qingdao University

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Hospital of Qingdao University

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Hospital of Qingdao University

brief_summary.textblock: Patients were aged >18 years with histological confirmed GC/EGJC and were refractory to the first line of therapy. Additional eligibility requirements included: ≥1 measurable disease at baseline per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors, version 1.1 (RECIST v 1.1); Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance status of 0 or 1; or life expectancy of ≥ 3 months and adequate organ function. The main exclusion criteria were interstitial lung disease, pulmonary fibrosis, active or prior autoimmune disease or active hepatitis, or history of anlotinib or any other PD-L1/PD-1 antagonist treatment. Patients with abdominal fistula, diverticulitis, gastrointestinal ulcerative disease or perforation, or abdominal abscess within the prior 4 weeks were also excluded. This study was an open, exploratory single-arm, phase II trial. Enrolled patients received anlotinib (12mg, po. qd, d1-14) combined with toripalimab (240 mg, inv, over 30 min once every 2 weeks).

clinical_study.condition: Advanced, Relapsed Gastric or Gastro-oesophageal Junction Carcinoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: patients with CPS ≥ 1 or MSI-H or TMB ≥ 10Mb/MUT
patients with CPS =0 , MSS and TMB < 10Mb/mut

intervention.arm_group_label: patients with CPS =0 , MSS and TMB < 10Mb/mut
patients with CPS ≥ 1 or MSI-H or TMB ≥ 10Mb/MUT

study_pop.textblock: Patients were aged >18 years with histological confirmed GC/EGJC and were refractory to the first line of therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients were aged >18 years with histological confirmed GC/EGJC and were refractory to the first line of therapy. Additional eligibility requirements included: ≥1 measurable disease at baseline per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors, version 1.1 (RECIST v 1.1); Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance status of 0 or 1; or life expectancy of ≥ 3 months and adequate organ function.
Exclusion Criteria:
The main exclusion criteria were interstitial lung disease, pulmonary fibrosis, active or prior autoimmune disease or active hepatitis, or history of anlotinib or any other PD-L1/PD-1 antagonist treatment. Patients with abdominal fistula, diverticulitis, gastrointestinal ulcerative disease or perforation, or abdominal abscess within the prior 4 weeks were also excluded.
